text: hello this is chef Chad for food wishes
now with drought that's right this
recipe is so simple it doesn't even have
a name I'm just calling it trout of
course if you really want a name ask
some French chef they'll give you a long
name for this and you know it'll have
lots of accent marks but for me I'm just
going with trout I'm going to throw four
tablespoons of butter in a saucepan put
it on medium-low heat
I'm also going to need 2 tablespoons of
fresh lemon juice
don't use concentrate juice a lemon
alright so we've got 2 tablespoons of
lemon juice I'm also going to need some
fresh chopped Italian parsley a couple
tablespoons there we go alright the
butter is going to cook until it gets
nutty and golden brown you're actually
going to smell this beautiful toasted
butter aroma that people refer to as
nutty but really you want to look and go
by the color when it's at just beautiful
golden brown I think it's done some
chefs they'll let it get almost brown
sometimes even go dark brown but that's
up to you alright so when the butter is
like that turn it off to finish the dish
I'm going to take about a half a
teaspoon and spread it on my boneless
rainbow trout they come home very simple
to use the bones are already going to be
taken out except for this tiny little
strip down the middle that you don't eat
I'm going to spread a little bit of that
brown butter on just like a half a
teaspoon salt and pepper generously and
then place it under a preheated hop
broiler about five or six inches away
from the heat and it's only going to
take a couple minutes
trout cooks fast which is why I like it
so it's just barely firm to the touch
it's done if you want to flake it with a
fork that's another way to test it but
you know you kind of wreck it you can
tell to finish turn your butter back on
to high heat it's already still pretty
warm so it's going to heat up pretty
quick dump in your lemon juice and your
parsley and as soon as it boils you're
done I told you it was easy
that's why does it have a name there's
really nothing to it put your hot trout
on a plate spoon over some of that brown
butter lemon parsley sauce and just
enjoy super simple seafood this is just
such an easy weeknight dinner every
grocery store has
rainbow trout now it's a very earth
friendly seafood choice by the way I
keep saying seafood it doesn't come from
the sea but you know what if that kind
of thing bothers you you're on the wrong
block all right very healthy low in fat
except for the butter and just a really
nice way to cook fish especially if
you're scared of cooking fish there's
really no way to screw this up seriously
so I hope you give that a try go to the
site all the ingredients are there and
as always enjoy
